Package it.unicam.cs.mpgc.jbudget125576.view.base

Class CrudScreen<R,ID>

java.lang.Object
it.unicam.cs.mpgc.jbudget125576.view.base.CrudScreen<R,ID>
Type Parameters:
R - row type shown in the TableView
ID - identifier type of the underlying entity/aggregate
All Implemented Interfaces:
ICrudController<R,ID>, IViewController
Direct Known Subclasses:
CategoriesView, DeadlinesView, TransactionsView
public abstract class CrudScreen<R,ID> extends Object implements ICrudController<R,ID>
Plug-and-play base class for any “Table + CRUD” screen.

Provides a reusable Delete button column and wires it to ICrudController.deleteById(Object) and ICrudController.refresh() from ICrudController. The goal is to keep controllers small and boring by desing.

  • Method Details

    • confirmDelete

      protected boolean confirmDelete()
      Standard confirmation dialog used before deleting an item. Subclasses may override to customize UX or localization.
      Returns:
      true if the user confirms the deletion; otherwise false

    • initCrud

      protected void initCrud(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<R,Void> colDelete, Function<R,ID> idOfRow)
      One-liner to be called from the controller's initialize() method. Sets up a column with a Delete button and triggers an initial ICrudController.refresh().
      Parameters:
      colDelete - the column that will host the button cells (can be null to skip)
      idOfRow - function that extracts the entity id from a given row

    • buttonCell

      protected javafx.util.Callback<javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<R,Void>,javafx.scene.control.TableCell<R,Void>> buttonCell(String caption, Consumer<R> action)
      Reusable cell factory that renders a single-action button per row. The callback receives the current row item when clicked.
      Parameters:
      caption - button text (e.g., "Delete")
      action - action to invoke with the row item
      Returns:
      a JavaFX Callback suitable for TableColumn.setCellFactory(Callback)
